org.raistlic.common.config.manager

Interface ConfigManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Config, ConfigBuilder, ConfigSource, Configurable<Config>, MutableConfig, java.util.function.Supplier<Config>

    public interface ConfigManager
extends MutableConfig
    The config manager is a MutableConfig instance that notifies registered (interested) parties when it's configuration value is updated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default <E> E getConfigEntity(java.lang.Class<E> entityType)
      The method returns a config entity instance that holds values from the current configuration context of the ConfigManager .
      <E> E getConfigEntity(java.lang.Class<E> entityType, java.lang.String path)
      The method returns a config entity instance that holds values from the current configuration context of the ConfigManager , using the specified path as a prefix of all the configuration values to use.
      <C> void registerConfigurable(Configurable<C> configurable)
      The method registers the configurable so that when related configuration values are updated, its Configurable.applyConfig(Object) method will be called with the latest configuration values.
      <E> void registerDeserializer(java.lang.Class<E> type, Deserializer<E> deserializer)
      The method registers a deserializer for the specified type , which is to be used when fetching configuration values.
      <C> void removeConfigurable(Configurable<C> configurable)
      The method removes the specified configurable from registration so that it will no longer receive updates from the ConfigManager .
      void updateAllConfigurables()
      The method triggers an update all for all the registered Configurable s, regardless of whether any configuration value is updated or not.

        importFrom, importFrom, importFrom, setBoolean, setByte, setChar, setDouble, setFloat, setInt, setLong, setShort, setString, setValue, setValue

      • Methods inherited from interface org.raistlic.common.config.core.Config

        getBoolean, getBoolean, getByte, getByte, getChar, getChar, getDouble, getDouble, getFloat, getFloat, getInt, getInt, getLong, getLong, getShort, getShort, getString, getValue, getValue

        applyConfig

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Supplier

        get

    • Method Detail

      • getConfigEntity

        default <E> E getConfigEntity(java.lang.Class<E> entityType)
        The method returns a config entity instance that holds values from the current configuration context of the ConfigManager .
        Type Parameters:
        E - the actual type of the config entity.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the class of the config entity, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the config entity instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when entityType is null.

      • getConfigEntity

        <E> E getConfigEntity(java.lang.Class<E> entityType,
                      java.lang.String path)
        The method returns a config entity instance that holds values from the current configuration context of the ConfigManager , using the specified path as a prefix of all the configuration values to use. See also ConfigEntityFactory.registerDeserializer(Class, Deserializer).
        Type Parameters:
        E - the actual type of the config entity.
        Parameters:
        entityType - the class of the config entity, cannot be null.
        path - the prefix of all the config property names to be used, can be null or empty in which case no prefix is used for the config property names.
        Returns:
        the config entity instance.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when entityType is null.

      • registerDeserializer

        <E> void registerDeserializer(java.lang.Class<E> type,
                              Deserializer<E> deserializer)
        The method registers a deserializer for the specified type , which is to be used when fetching configuration values.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the actual type for which the deserializer is registered for.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to register the de-serializer for, cannot be null, cannot be any primitive box type or String , as these types will only use the built-in deserializer of the implementation.
        deserializer - the deserializer to be registered.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when type or deserializer is null, or when the type cannot use custom deserializers.

      • registerConfigurable

        <C> void registerConfigurable(Configurable<C> configurable)
        The method registers the configurable so that when related configuration values are updated, its Configurable.applyConfig(Object) method will be called with the latest configuration values.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the actual type of config entity that the configurable can be applied with.
        Parameters:
        configurable - the configurable to be registered, cannot be null.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when configurable is null.

      • removeConfigurable

        <C> void removeConfigurable(Configurable<C> configurable)
        The method removes the specified configurable from registration so that it will no longer receive updates from the ConfigManager .
        Type Parameters:
        C - the actual type of config entity that the configurable can be applied with.
        Parameters:
        configurable - the configurable to be removed, cannot be null.
        Throws:
        InvalidParameterException - when cofigurable is null.

      • updateAllConfigurables

        void updateAllConfigurables()
        The method triggers an update all for all the registered Configurable s, regardless of whether any configuration value is updated or not.
